sentences.en: And what inspired you to change your name?
Chef Idris Caldora offers an inspired menu that captures the spirit of the Mediterranean.
sentences.cn: 厨师伊德里斯·卡尔多拉开出一份富有地中海特色的菜单，让人眼前一亮。

sentences.en: Despite his unconventional methods, he has inspired pupils more than anyone else.
sentences.cn: 尽管他的方法不同寻常，但他给予学生的激励比其他人都要多。

sentences.en: Every single one of those inspired guesses had been shots in the dark.
sentences.cn: 所有那些凭直觉的猜测都是无根据的瞎猜。

sentences.en: He called Mr Mandela a hero who had inspired millions.
sentences.cn: 他称曼德拉先生为鼓舞了数百万民众的英雄。

sentences.en: He had a presence that inspired and a voice that compelled.
sentences.cn: 他的神态令人敬畏,他的声音令人敬从.

sentences.en: Here the apostle Peter affirms his belief that the Scriptures are'inspired '.
sentences.cn: 使徒彼得在此表达了他相信《圣经》是通过默感写成的.

sentences.en: It inspired me to be more inventive with my own cooking.
sentences.cn: 它激发我在自己烹饪时更富创造性。

sentences.en: Jimi Hendrix inspired a generation of guitarists.
sentences.cn: 吉米·亨德里克斯启发了整整一代吉他演奏者。

sentences.en: The actors inspired the kids with their enthusiasm.
sentences.cn: 演员以热情鼓舞着孩子们。

sentences.en: The programme was worth watching for an inspired takeoff of the Collins sisters.
sentences.cn: 这个节目值得一看，因为有对柯林斯姐妹的滑稽创意模仿。

sentences.en: The victory inspired him to dispatch a gleeful telegram to Roosevelt.
sentences.cn: 胜利促使他给罗斯福发了封喜报。

sentences.en: There was a glow on his face , wrinkled by a life time of suffering, that inspired one with a feeling of unshakable optimism.
sentences.cn: 他那饱经风霜的多皱的脸上发着光彩, 使人产生一种乐观的感觉.

sentences.en: You inspired me by playing the piano so beautifully.
sentences.cn: 你弹奏的优美的钢琴曲激发了我的灵感.

words.tran_cn: 鼓舞人心的；灌输的；启发灵感的
鼓舞；激发；使感悟（inspire的ing形式）
激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

trans.tran_cn: 有创造力的，品质优秀的，有雄心壮志的，（与名词、形容词以及副词构成形容词）受…影响的
鼓舞( inspire的过去式和过去分词 )，激励，赋予某人灵感，启迪
